data.title: Ported CnC-Campaign from our student project (now generalised)
data.body:
Hello,
we are back with our campaign menu, but since we changed a lot of things, we decided to open a new pull request.
The original PR can be found here(https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7559).
Here are the changes/additions from the last PR:
- Faction selection
  - the .vqa files are not mandatory anymore and we can remove them, if that is preferred
  - a custom recreation of the transmission-select screen if no vqa is found
- alternative mission selection (Campaign-Preview, i.e. a-,b-,c-missions)
  - the mission following a victory is declared in the yaml of the map (“Next Mission”), which allows for branching campaign-paths
  - If no preview-picture is available the faction logo appears
- Generalization, so it should work for all mods
  - currently active in the cnc and ra mods
- Other requests
  - use MapCache instead of manual preview
  - implement SaveProgressFlag
  - used OnPlayerWon Event to save the campaign progress

data.title: Fix ActionQueue ordering
data.body:
Fixes #9286.

This enforces a well defined ordering for ActionQueue to ensure it runs actions in the the order one would expect.

data.title: Game.RunAfterTick & RunAfterDelay are badly sequenced
data.body:
Consider the following:

``` c#
Game.RunAfterDelay(0, () => Console.WriteLine("A0"));
Game.RunAfterDelay(0, () => Console.WriteLine("B0"));
Game.RunAfterDelay(0, () => Console.WriteLine("C0"));
Game.RunAfterDelay(1000, () => Console.WriteLine("A1"));
Game.RunAfterDelay(1000, () => Console.WriteLine("B1"));
Game.RunAfterDelay(1000, () => Console.WriteLine("C1"));
Game.RunAfterDelay(2000, () => Console.WriteLine("A2"));
Game.RunAfterDelay(2000, () => Console.WriteLine("B2"));
Game.RunAfterDelay(2000, () => Console.WriteLine("C2"));
```

This produces:

```
B0
C0
A0
C1
A1
B1
B2
A2
C2
```

whereas I would expect (and prefer) queue-like behaviour:

```
A0
B0
C0
A1
B1
C1
A2
B2
C2
```

data.title: Soviet Airfield active animation played incorectly
data.body:
Active animation of airfield is played only when it rearms aircraft
Steps to reproduce:
1. Start Soviet 02
2. Buid yak
3. Attack somethind with plane and return for rearming on any of two airfields.
4. Watch difference

data.title: TD: Add additional desert tiles (work originally by psydev)
data.body:
from https://github.com/psydev/OpenRA/commits/desert (last updated 2014-05-25):

> There is some art in RA Desert tileset that is not in TD. It looks as though it belongs
> to the original, but not sure.
> They look really good, so including them in TD. There were some "pink
> templates" (lacking image) which now have an image (br5.des and
> br10.des). Were they missing? They look like they belong in the original
> game.

this looks like a worthwhile addition and doesn't look as if it was ever pulled into the main OpenRA code; it also doesn't look as if psydev is still working on it.

I think it is ok I submit this (I haven't been in contact with psydev)

![beforeafter](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10729559/9703982/0dc7f000-5495-11e5-8124-196c8643e930.png)

data.title: Changed D2k weapon names to match original
data.body: And some minor cleanup to prepare for stat-changing PR.

data.title: Don't allow teamchat if not assigned to a team.
data.body:
Currently you can tab to teamchat if your are not assigned to a team in lobby chat.
These messages are not sent to anyone who _is_ teamed.

closes #9277 

having both uppercase and lowercase variable names does not increase readability

data.title: More HashSet trait fields & Lint support
data.body: More `string[]` => `HashSet<string>` for trait fields with Lint reference support for `HashSet<string>` trait fields.

data.title: Rename d2k actors to match original game rules.
data.body: A small step towards making #9106 reviewer friendly.  Works towards #7558.

data.title: nod05 (Warthog Hunt): bogus code?
data.body: there is a checkProduction() function in the script, which looks as if the AI should try to replace destroyed units - but when playing with debug cheats the AI never seems to build anything

data.title: gdi01: cannot complete secondary objective
data.body:
I build all three buildings, but the objective is not marked as completed

I am reworking some aspects of the script in gdi01 and the objective will be marked as "completed" then, but I wonder: can anyone complete the objective, and what exactly causes it?

data.title: Make edge and keyboard scrolling use delta time
data.body:
Currently edge and keyboard camera scrolling is really choppy (25 fps according to pchote) that looks bad (and strains my eyes). I suggest to make them use delta time just like middle mouse scrolling does atm.

data.title: Don’t create multiple sound contexts.
data.body: Fixes #9271, which was a regression introduced by #8632.

data.title: TD: make cliffs unbuildable
data.body:
fixes #9265 

I assume "Rough" means "can walk on, but cannot be built on", at least it seems that way during gameplay

data.title: Remove the broken actor stats export command.
data.body:
The DPS values are calculated / reported for only the first warhead on the last defined weapon on an actor.  This means that it reports the garrisoned weapon stats for most infantry, the elite weapon stats for many TS actors, and arbitrary values for units that define multiple weapons (rocket troopers, mamoth tanks, etc).  These values aren't very meaningful.  We now also support upgradeable armors.

This appears to have been broken for quite some time, so the fact that nobody has discovered or reported it before now shows that it is probably not used or worth the (significant) effort of making it work properly.

data.title: Made BlocksProjectiles upgradable
data.body: Needed for TS firestorm defense and laser fences.

data.title: Grab MasterServer urls directly from Website instead of hardcoding it.
data.body:
It would be usefull to remove the Masterserver URL from the code and grab them from the website openra.net as like the mirror lists. on fail of dns or domain fail the master server can be reached over other urls. atm the Client is not able to grab new ones when they can not be reached.

this will enable also load balancing client can redirected when able to other masterservers when one is failing. as far i see we have only one. :(

idea: hardcode 1 address but enable the support vor grabbing new ones via website. when the hardcoded failes.

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/26472469-grab-masterserver-urls-directly-from-website-instead-of-hardcoding-it?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Implement support for directional armor
data.body:
A possible, relatively simple approach would be to compare the projectile facing right before explosion with the facing of directly hit actors (explosion happened inside their health radius / hit box / whatever).

If the projectile facing exactly matched or diverted by no more than X degrees, it must have hit the weak rear armor, giving a damage bonus.
If the facing was the opposite, it must have hit the front, reducing the damage.
In between it must have hit the sides, so apply normal damage.

This is just a possibility. If we had a raycaster and rectangular hit boxes, it would be possible to check more accurately what side was hit.

data.title: Lua API documentation cleanup
data.body:
also reduces amount of headings with only a single entry
- SendAirStrike() - now listed under "Support Powers"
- Guard() - now listed under "Combat"
- FindResources() - now listed under "Movement"
- Deploy() - now listed under "General"
- SendParaTroopers() - now listed under "Support Powers"
- Paradrop() - now listed under "Transports"

Teleport() should probably be listed under "Movement", but I don't know how to change that (currently listed under "General").

note that I changed "ScriptGlobal" to "ScriptPropertyGroup" for SendAirStrike() - I hope that does not screw up anything

data.title: Not all Armaments ranges are taken into account in reach target checks
data.body:
If you have multiple Armaments only the first one will be counted for the unit range. And if you for example disable (with upgrades) the first armament (which might have a longer range then the second Armament) then the unit will just stand still and try to shot but cant reach the target. As the range for the units is not updated upon disabling the first Armament.

data.title: Make AppearsOnRadar implement INotifyCreated
data.body:
- "Cache the IRadarColorModifier so we don't look for it on every render tick."

PR-ed separately from its original branch as wished by @RoosterDragon .

data.title: Move asset installation to the ModChooser
data.body:
Closes #8990.

That ticket pretty much explains what is going on here and why.

The progress bar will probably need polishing. Other than that I think it's done.

I **strongly** suggest reviewing the code by commits and not the entire diff.

data.title: Speed up FrozenUnderFog.Tick
data.body:
FrozenUnderFog.Tick gets called a lot, and most of that time is spent doing the two dictionary lookups.

This change stuffs everything into one dictionary. This means only one lookup and saves 40% of the time spent in this method.

data.title: Implement aggregate sequences
data.body: Basically, finish [this](https://github.com/pchote/OpenRA/tree/aggregate-sequences).

data.title: Fixed the legacy isometric tileset importer
data.body: Followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7757.
